Steps.Message: Update at 14:45 - This is Rob from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the delays in restoring your power today, I know being without power for this long isn't easy, especially in colder weather. Our staff have been in contact to advise progress on the excavations and repairs has been slower than anticipated, and so they need a while longer to get power back on safely. We're now estimating power will be back on between 16:00 and 17:00. I'm sorry to advise you another delay, but I'll continue to keep you updated with our progress as it comes in from site. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here on 08003163106.

We became aware of a power cut at 04:47. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area.
